channel.title: Digital Collections at Wayne State University Libraries » News
channel.description: News and features from the WSULS Digital Collections

item.title: Digital Collections get a new face
item.dc:creator: Joshua Neds-Fox
item.description: Digital Collections have increasingly been at the forefront of the WSU Library System’s priorities, and this year we’re introducing a new face for our collections. Our existing system is great at organizing and serving up images, but not so good at handling other kinds of digital items — texts, videos, audio, or combinations of digital […]
item.content:encoded:
Digital Collections have increasingly been at the forefront of the WSU Library System’s priorities, and this year we’re introducing a new face for our collections. Our existing system is great at organizing and serving up images, but not so good at handling other kinds of digital items — texts, videos, audio, or combinations of digital files. So we’ve spent the past year laying the groundwork for a new digital collection system, using Fedora Commons as the digital object repository and a custom mix of PHP and Python to build the front end. If that’s confusing, don’t worry — the results are clean, useable, and highly interesting.

There’s this photo of Ed Wynn in his 1932 Packard Coupe Roadster. There’s Dr. Adrian Kantrowitz, who performed the first human heart transplant in the United States in 1967, smoking a pipe and examining medical instruments. There’s this letter, in which Abraham Lincoln appoints an interim Secretary of the Treasury and signs his full name. And there’s this fully readable ebook of Rip Van Winkle from 1921, in full color.
Some collections have yet to be migrated, including our flagship Virtual Motor City and Digital Dress collections. But these will follow presently, and be greatly improved by the new affordances of this digital collection system. Please give us a spin, then let us know what you think at https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/QHWX3V7.
